author: Staff Reporter
text:
Masha Nazeem, a ‘young scientist’ from the district who has invented various useful products, has been invited to participate as a guest speaker at the 103rd Indian Science Congress to be held at Mysuru University for five days from January 3.

Masha Nazeem, hailing from Eravipudhurkadai in the district, is pursuing a postgraduate course at SRM University, Chennai, and she will give a special lecture at the Indian Science Congress, to be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Over 20,000 scientists, including five Nobel laureates, are expected to participate in the Congress. Sources at Masha Innovation Centre in Kanyakumari said that Ms. Nazeem would deliver lectures at the Children’s Science Congress, Women’s Science Congress and Indian Science Exhibition Hall on five subjects.

Ms. Nazeem, who had given guest lectures at IIMs in Ahmedabad and Kashipur and several other premier institutions, was one among the five persons selected for training at Google Headquarters in the USA, the sources added.
title: Honour for student from Kanyakumari
